title: Complementary Strengths
description: Explore how your strengths complement each other and make you stronger together.

questions.text: One of my greatest strengths is...
choices: My ability to stay calm under pressure
My empathy and understanding of others

therapeutic.rationale: Naming strengths builds confidence and self-awareness. Calm-under-pressure types regulate well; empaths connect deeply; determined types persist; creatives innovate. Knowing your strengths helps you contribute them to the relationship.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different strengths are complementary. Your partnership benefits from diverse capabilities.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared strengths create alignment in certain areas while potentially creating gaps in others.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's one of your greatest strengths? How does it help your relationship?

questions.text: An area where I know I want to grow is...

therapeutic.rationale: Naming growth edges shows self-awareness. Patience-builders work on acceptance; communicators work on expression; stress-managers work on regulation; presence-builders work on attention. Acknowledging edges invites support.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different growth edges are individual. Understanding your partner's edge helps you support without judging.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared growth edges create opportunity for mutual development.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's an area where you want to grow? How can your partner support you?

questions.text: A strength you bring that complements mine is...
choices: You balance my intensity or energy
You see things from a different angle
You bring out the best in me

therapeutic.rationale: Recognizing complementary strengths honors partnership. Weakness-fillers complete; balancers moderate; angle-bringers diversify; best-bringers elevate. Acknowledging your partner's contribution strengthens appreciation.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different recognitions are both valid. You may notice different ways you complement each other.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched recognition shows aligned appreciation for how you work together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What strength does your partner bring that complements yours? Have you told them?

questions.text: You help me with my growth edges by...

therapeutic.rationale: Growth support takes different forms. Patient supporters give time; modelers demonstrate; accountable supporters provide structure; unconditional lovers provide safety. Knowing how your partner helps you honors their contribution.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different forms of support are all valuable. You each contribute unique gifts to each other's growth.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched appreciation shows you value similar support in your growth.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does your partner help you with your growth edges? Have you acknowledged this?

questions.text: Together, I believe we're strongest at...
choices: Supporting each other through hard times
Having fun and enjoying life together

therapeutic.rationale: Naming couple strengths builds shared identity. Support-strengths show resilience; fun-strengths show joy; communication-strengths show connection; goal-strengths show direction. Recognizing what you do well together reinforces it.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different perceptions of strength are both valid. You may notice different aspects of your partnership.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched perception creates shared pride in your relationship's strengths.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What are you strongest at as a couple? How can you build on that strength?
